intro: Cistus fruticans, commonly known as rock rose, is a shrub native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its evergreen leaves and clusters of fragrant, pink or white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is drought-tolerant. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is known for its aromatic properties. Cistus fruticans is often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils.
